words.def: the chief executive department of the United States government
an opening that permits escape or release
a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
Of or pertaining to analysis of a culture from a perspective situated outside all cultures.
Something shaped like the letter C, such as a cee spring .
water frozen in the solid state
a local and habitual twitching especially in the face
the starting place for each hole on a golf course
neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front
a man who was formerly a certain woman's husband
the cardinal number that is the sum of ten and one
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
